value.expression:
("<|system|>
You are Granite Chat, an AI language model developed by IBM. You are a cautious assistant. You carefully follow instructions. You are helpful and harmless and you follow ethical guidelines and promote positive behavior.
<|user|>
You are a AI language model designed to function as a specialized Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) assistant. When generating responses, prioritize correctness, i.e., ensure that your response is correct given the context and user query, and that it is grounded in the context. Furthermore, make sure that the response is supported by the given document or context. When the question cannot be answered using the context or document, output the following response: 'I apologize, but I could not locate any relevant information.' Always make sure that your response is relevant to the question. If an explanation is needed, first provide the explanation or reasoning, and then give the final answer.
Answer Length: comprehensive.
").concat(${passages}).concat(${query_text}).concat("
<|assistant|>
")

concat.scalar:
***WARNING***
**discovery_project_id** is not defined, which will cause queries to **Watson Discovery** to fail.
To find your Watson Discovery project_id, please open [your Watson Discovery instance](https://cloud.ibm.com/resources), open your Watson Discovery project, navigate to 'Integrate and deploy', then click 'API Information', then copy the Project ID.
Then,

set the initial value of discovery_project_id to this copied Project ID by opening your Assistant instance, navigating to the Actions page, clicking 'Created by me' under 'Variables', clicking discovery_project_id, pasting the Project ID as the Initial value, and clicking Save.
-- Need more help? Contact your IBM representative, [book a call](https://www.ibm.
com/account/reg/signup?formid=MAIL-watson), or [email our team](https://www.ibm.com/account/reg/us-en/signup?formid=MAIL-watsonassistant) for support.

***WARNING***
**watsonx_project_id** is not defined, which will cause calls to **watsonx** to fail.
To find your watsonx project_id, please open [your watsonx instance](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/wx/home?context=wx), click your watsonx project, navigate to 'Manage', then click 'General', then copy the Project ID.
Then,

set the initial value of watsonx_project_id to this copied Project ID by opening your Assistant instance, navigating to the Actions page, clicking 'Created by me' under 'Variables', clicking watsonx_project_id, pasting the Project ID as the Initial value, and clicking Save.
-- Need more help? Contact your IBM representative, [book a call](https://www.ibm.
com/account/reg/signup?formid=MAIL-watson), or [email our team](https://www.ibm.com/account/reg/us-en/signup?formid=MAIL-watsonassistant) for support.
Sorry, the search failed!
Account already exist in our database!

intents.description: Please transfer me to an agent

variables.title: discovery_date_version
variables.description: Discovery date versions are documented in the release notes (https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/discovery-data?topic=discovery-data-release-notes).

variables.title: discovery_project_id
variables.description: You MUST set this value to the project ID of the Discovery project containing your data

variables.title: model_id
variables.description: The ID of the model to be used for this user prompt.

variables.title: model_input
variables.description: input to the watsonx model

variables.title: model_parameters_decoding_method
variables.description: The strategy used for picking the tokens during generation of the output text.

variables.title: model_parameters_include_stop_sequence
variables.description: The value to control presence of matched stop sequences from the end of the output text.

variables.title: model_parameters_max_new_tokens
variables.description: The maximum number of new tokens to be generated.

variables.title: model_parameters_min_new_tokens
variables.description: The minimum number of new tokens to be generated.

variables.title: model_parameters_random_seed
variables.description: A random number generator seed to use in sampling mode for experimental repeatability.

variables.title: model_parameters_repetition_penalty
variables.description: The penalty for penalizing tokens that have already been generated or belong to the context.

variables.title: model_parameters_stop_sequences
variables.description: The strings which will cause the text generation to stop if/when they are produced as part of the output. Stop sequences encountered prior to the minimum number of tokens being generated will be ignored.

variables.title: model_parameters_temperature
variables.description: The value used to control the next token probabilities. The range is from 0.05 to 1.00; 0.05 makes it mostly deterministic.

variables.title: model_parameters_time_limit
variables.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before stopping generation. The text generated so far will be returned along with the TIME_LIMIT stop reason.

variables.title: model_parameters_top_k
variables.description: The number of highest probability vocabulary tokens to keep for top-k-filtering.

variables.title: model_parameters_top_p
variables.description: Similar to top_k except the candidates to generate the next token are the most likely tokens with probabilities that add up to at least top_p.

variables.title: model_response
variables.description: The text generated by the model in response to the model input

variables.title: query_text
variables.description: You MAY change this to pass queries to Watson Discovery. By default the Search action passes the user’s input.text directly.

variables.title: search_results
variables.description: Response object from Discovery query (https://cloud.ibm.com/apidocs/discovery-data#query).

variables.title: verbose
variables.description: Prints debug output when true

variables.title: watsonx_api_version
variables.description: The version of the watsonx api (required)

variables.title: watsonx_project_id
variables.description: You MUST set this to your watsonx project id
